de.frauas.jdemandmodel.occupancy

Class CSVMarkovReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.reader.CSVReader
      • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.occupancy.CSVMarkovReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MarkovReader

    public class CSVMarkovReader
extends CSVReader
implements MarkovReader
    This class is used to read the data needed for creating a Markov chain. This data was copied from the CREST Domestic Electricity Demand Model (http://hdl.handle.net/2134/5786) to files that can be found at "input/".
    Author:
    lukas

    • Method Detail

      • readTransitionMatrices

        public java.util.ArrayList<Matrix> readTransitionMatrices()
        Sorts the Markov data from a csv file and returns a list of matrices organized like this:

        0: { { p1, p2, p3 }, { p4, p5, p6 }, { p7, p8, p9 } }

        1: { { p10, p11 ...

        ...

        The position in the list represents the time interval and each list entry consists of arrays of probabilities for each current occupancy state, e.g. p6 would be the probability that in time interval one (0:), if there was already one person at home (array 1), that another person appears (position 2 in array), and so on.
        Specified by:
        readTransitionMatrices in interface MarkovReader
        Returns:
        a list of transition matrices.

      • readInitialProbabilities

        public double[] readInitialProbabilities()
        Reads the start probability data from the files mentioned above, rearranges it and returns the occupancy probabilities.
        Specified by:
        readInitialProbabilities in interface MarkovReader
        Returns:
        an array of occupancy probabilities for the first time interval.

      • getPath

        private java.lang.String getPath()
        Depending on the given values of weekend and chosen residentCount, returns the correct file path.
        Returns:
        "input/{1-5}_w{d/e}.csv".
